TopicTitle: What would we do if there was a real AZ5 Coming to us?

Articles.Content:
What would we do?

I'm not much of a scientist. So...Yeah what would we do? Go on an "Evacuate Earth" Kind of thing? Or just wait for our impending doom?

Edited January 12, 2014 by ThatKerbal

We'd die trying.

But seriously, what could be more galvanizing to us as a species than the struggle for our own survival?

It depends how much warning we have. A larger impact could create a heatwave that would incinerate pretty much everything on the surface. The smoke and fallout would create a nuclear winter that would last for several years. If we get through that, we'll be fine.

If we have a decade or two, we could probably dig ourselves in and brace for the impact. Bury as much as we can as deep as we can: nuclear plants, shelters, food supplies, biological specimens, communication and coordination centers, art and cultural stuff, and as much equipment as possible to get started when it's over. We might also be able to put some stuff underwater.

Moving to space would be pretty much the hardest thing to do. With current technology, the best we could do is send up a few hundred people and bring them back after the impact. We don't have technology to survive in space indefinitely yet. We'd have better chances or survival by building thousands of deep vaults all around the world. At least some of them would be able to survive the impact.

If we only have a few months, we're probably toast.
